content.question: The 98 percent confidence interval <math alttext="negative 0.248 comma negative 0.134" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.248</mn><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.134</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> was constructed to estimate the slope of a regression model for a bivariate data set with 20 values. Alice claims that a sample size of 25 will produce a narrower interval, all other things remaining the same. Desmond claims that a sample size of 15 will produce a narrower interval. Which statement is true about the claims made by Alice and Desmond?

choices.label: Both Alice’s claim and Desmond’s claim are correct.
Neither Alice’s claim nor Desmond’s claim is correct.
There is not enough information to determine whether the claims are correct.

topic.text: 9.3: Justifying a Claim About the Slope of a Regression Model Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Make an appropriate claim or draw an appropriate conclusion.
